Result-oriented, self-driven, initiator and fast-learner. Experience Software Engineering Director, RealSense Technology Intel Corporation March 2015  – Present (6 months) Jerusalem • Manage research and development activities related to hand tracking and gesture recognition in the Perceptual Computing Division. 
 
• Aiming to provide a worldwide reliable Hands based Person-Machine interface. 
 
 Algorithms Group Manager, RealSense Technology Intel Corporation July 2013  –  March 2015  (1 year 9 months) Jerusalem • Leading the algorithmic development of the Hand Tracking and Gesture Recognition group.  
• In charge of the design and implementation of hand analysis algorithms using depth camera data. 
• End to end responsibility for project components, starting from the research stage, implementation, and productization of a RealTime commercial solution, sold in millions starting in 2015.  Algorithm R&D Team Leader XTR3D July 2012  –  August 2013  (1 year 2 months) • Leading a team of 6-8 experienced algorithm developers. 
• Developing an innovative Full-Body 3D skeleton real time tracking algorithm using a single 2D camera for natural user interface, used for gaming and security markets. 
• Responsible for the definition and assignment of tasks to supportive software and QA personnel. 
• Managing using Agile methodology, while closely involved in the research and development process. Senior Algorithm Developer XTR3D November 2010  –  July 2012  (1 year 9 months) • Designing and implementing low-level and high-level video processing and computer vision algorithms, applied on real-time, state-of-the-art Natural User Interface products in C/C++, adopted by major worldwide systems vendors. 
• Applied SCRUM project management methodology. 
• Main Projects:  
* Full-Body 3D skeleton using a single 2D camera for the gaming and security markets. 
* Palm detection and tracking for NUI on a wide variety of consumer electronics products. 
* Gesture recognition using generic uncontrolled camera on stationary and mobile platforms. Computer Vision Algorithm Developer Mobileye February 2009  –  November 2010  (1 year 10 months) • Designed and developed state-of-the-art vehicle mounted risk detection systems, applying real-time computer vision and machine learning methodologies. 
• Real time Lane status and risk assessment. International Road sign detection and interpretation. Real time compliance assessment and warning. Algorithms Research Team Leader 8200, Israel Defense Forces June 2006  –  January 2009  (2 years 8 months) • In command of 7 senior researchers (mathematicians, engineers and physicists) team. 
• CTO for complex mathematical problems and advance research in the field of communications, in-team, greater 8200 and non-8200 counterparts. 
• In charge of professional and personal development for individual team members. Mathematical Researcher 8200, Israel Defense Forces August 2002  –  June 2006  (3 years 11 months) Researched and Developed communication algorithms in the Physical OSI layer, such as error-correction codes, PDH multiplexers, interleavers, scramblers, encoders, etc. Mathematic Researcher and QA Aladdin September 2000  –  August 2004  (4 years) • Research and evaluation of strength, penetration and flaws in company’s security and encryption algorithms. programmer Israel Defense Forces 2002  –  2003  (1 year) Software Engineering Director, RealSense Technology Intel Corporation March 2015  – Present (6 months) Jerusalem • Manage research and development activities related to hand tracking and gesture recognition in the Perceptual Computing Division.
